intro: Alysicarpus vaginalis var. parvifolius, commonly known as small-leaf velvet bean, is a tropical legume native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces small, hairy pods containing kidney-shaped seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its rapid growth, it is sometimes used for soil stabilization and as a forage crop.
